modules.description: The module provides serialization, deserialization, and string conversion functionalities for policy, version, config, and session data, along with retrieval mechanisms for session and policy information. It operates on internally defined types for these entities, enabling structured data management and state persistence. Use cases include configuration storage, version control, and session tracking in applications requiring structured data handling.

Initiates, manages, and terminates OTR encrypted sessions, handling message encryption, decryption, and SMP protocol interactions. Operates on session state objects and processes raw string data to generate encrypted outputs, warnings, or handshake messages. Used to securely exchange messages, manage session lifecycles, and perform secure authentication checks between communication partners.

Calculates cryptographic fingerprints from a session state or a DSA private key, returning string representations of these values. It handles session-based peer identification and key-based local identity verification. Used to generate and retrieve unique identifiers for secure communication endpoints.

Calculates shared secrets using the Socialist Millionaires Protocol to authenticate communication partners over an encrypted channel. Performs elliptic curve operations and cryptographic key exchanges for secure messaging. Handles Diffie-Hellman parameters and ensures forward secrecy in encrypted conversations.

Handles OTR protocol operations including session management, message encryption/decryption, and secure key verification. It works with session states, DSA keys, and cryptographic fingerprints to enable secure instant messaging. Functions include generating encrypted messages, managing handshake exchanges, and verifying peer identities through zero-knowledge proofs. Examples include establishing secure channels, encrypting payloads, and generating fingerprint strings for identity confirmation.
